item.title: Reticulate, the great translator
item.description: As someone new to both R and python, it can get confusing knowing which syntax goes with which language. Or I'll learn how to do something really cool in R and have know idea how to get the same result in Python! That's where reticulate comes in handy. This allows you to move back in forth between R and python. Allow me to demonstrate: library(reticulate) riscool <- "I can use" Here I've started with an R code chunk.

item.title: My First Blog Post
item.description: Link to project 1 Link to google R code chunk 5+5 ## [1] 10 Python code chunk print(5+5) ## 10

item.title: Should I Open the Windows in my House?
item.description: Since we are in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, my roommates and I have been thinking a lot about air circulation. We got a CO2 monitor (since CO2 is a good proxy for how well the air is circulating in buildings) and we discovered that the CO2 in our house is pretty high! Not good! So we've been opening up the windows a lot lately, but have struggled to find a good time to do so given Texas's unpredictable weather.
